details.details:
*There are three different configurations of the original Wi-Fi only iPad. Configurations include 16 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB of storage and originally sold for US$499, US$599, and US$699, respectively.

Please note that on average the estimated current retail pricing of used systems is updated twice a year (please refer to the date on the bottom of the page for the date last updated).

Photo Credit: Apple, Inc.
details.audio_support: Apple reports that the iPad supports "AAC (16 to 320 Kbps), Protected AAC (from iTunes Store), MP3 (16 to 320 Kbps), MP3 VBR, Audible (formats 2, 3, 4), Apple Lossless, AIFF, and WAV."
details.photo_support: Apple reports that the iPad syncs iPod-viewable photos from iTunes. iTunes supports JPEG, BMP, GIF, TIFF, PSD (Mac only), and PNG formats.
details.video_support: Apple reports that the iPad supports "H.264 video up to 720p, 30 frames per second, Main Profile level 3.1 with AAC-LC audio up to 160 Kbps, 48kHz, stereo audio in .m4v, .mp4, and .mov file formats; MPEG-4 video, up to 2.5 Mbps, 640 by 480 pixels, 30 frames per second, Simple Profile with AAC-LC audio up to 160 Kbps, 48kHz, stereo audio in .m4v, .mp4, and .mov file formats."
details.incl_accessories:
The iPad also includes a "dock connector to USB cable, 10W power adapter, and documentation".

In the US (and many other countries), site sponsor Other World Computing sells accessories like cases, stands, keyboards, speakers and more for this iPad.

Also see: What is the best external keyboard for the full-size iPad models?

details.details:
*There are three original configurations of the iPad 2 (Wi-Fi). Configurations include 16 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB of storage -- in both white or black -- and sold for US$499, US$599, and US$699, respectively.

Please note that on average the estimated current retail pricing of used systems is updated twice a year (please refer to the date on the bottom of the page for the date last updated).

details.video_support: Apple reports that the iPad 2 supports "H.264 video up to 720p, 30 frames per second, Main Profile level 3.1 with AAC-LC audio up to 160 Kbps, 48kHz, stereo audio in .m4v, .mp4, and .mov file formats; MPEG-4 video, up to 2.5 Mbps, 640 by 480 pixels, 30 frames per second, Simple Profile with AAC-LC audio up to 160 Kbps per channel, 48kHz, stereo audio in .m4v, .mp4, and .mov file formats; Motion JPEG (M-JPEG) up to 35 Mbps, 1280 by 720 pixels, 30 frames per second, audio in ulaw, PCM stereo audio in .avi file format."

details.details:
*There originally were three configurations of the iPad mini (Wi-Fi Only). These configurations have 16 GB, 32 GB, and 64 GB of storage -- in both white and silver or black and slate -- and sold for US$329, US$429, and US$529, respectively.

**On October 22, 2013, Apple discontinued all of the 32 GB and 64 GB configurations, as well as the black and slate 16 GB configuration. It dropped the price of the 16 GB white and silver configuration to US$299 and introduced a new 16 GB black and "Space Gray" configuration for the same US$299 price. On October 16, 2014, Apple lowered the price of the remaining 16 GB configurations to US$249. The original iPad mini models were discontinued altogether on June 19, 2015.

Please note that on average the estimated current retail pricing of used systems is updated twice a year (please refer to the date on the bottom of the page for the date last updated).

Photo Credit: Apple, Inc.
